intro: Anulocaulis annulatus, commonly known as the ringed stem plant, is a unique member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, cylindrical stems that are covered in a dense, fibrous layer, giving it a ring-like appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom in clusters at the base of the stems. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
